result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel M Lazer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Due during term of supervision.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Submit to DNA sample while incarcerated.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel M Lazer in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives recommendation. Court finds matter to be a Domestic Violence Incident and renders sentence.
Sentencing hearing on March 23, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Daniel M Lazer in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. State gives a joint recommendation of a withheld sentence; 1 yr probation with conditions. Court sets sentencing over.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 11:45 am.
Per Atty Matt Last, matter is resolved. Defendant will enter change of plea on 3/11/16. Jury cancelled by clerk.

Defendant Daniel M Lazer appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with attorney Matt Last appearing in person.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel requesting jury trial date.   Counsel advises defendant is still on a probation hold; awaiting revocation decision.  Court and counsel attempting to schedule date.  Counsel requesting one final status to await revocation decision.  Court orders one day jury trial on March 11 at 8:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel M Lazer in court with attorney Matt Last .  Defendant in custody. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel enters not guilty plea.    Further proceedings scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
